page.title: 03NEW ROOFS FOR OLD
page.content: The major land use in the area is residential. The{housing}stock is varied. The older{housing}is mainly found towards the River Clyde and the City Centre. The sandstone{tenement,} built in the nineteenth century, is typical. The newer housing occupies most of the southern half of the area, and was built between the wars, two stories, (semi-detached, cottage style or terraces), being typical. The most recent postwar housing includes high- rise flats. There is much{local authority} {housing}but also some large areas of private{housing.} Most of the recently built{housing}is on the gap sites left by the demolition of Victorian {tenements,}with one former shipyard also used in this way. The remaining {tenements}are being modernised by Housing Associations.
